intro: Senecio anethifolius subsp. brevibracteolatus, commonly known as the narrow-bract senecio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It has a compact growth habit and is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance. The subspecies is distinguished by its shorter bracts compared to other members of the species.
